New Records: Holder's four wickets in four balls
Key Match Events: Jason Holder took four wickets in four balls to end England's innings in an instant
Akeal Hosein took 4-24 and ripped the guts from England’s reply
Kieron Pollard and Rovman Powell shared a destructive partnership
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies won the final T20 by 17 runs to complete a 3-2 series victory
England slipped to only a second T20 series defeat in their last 12
Miscellaneous Highlights: The West Indies innings was two-paced starting brightly, grinding to a half when Moeen Ali turned to spin, then accelerated with a late burst when the seamers came back on
England’s reply got off to a bad start with Jason Roy caught off his boot in front of the wicket by wicketkeeper Nicholas Pooran and Tom Banton miscuing Odean Smith to midwicket
Smith should have had two in two with Holder dropping Moeen Ali first ball
